label: 009. From the office of R.M. Marshall to M. -- September 12, 1883
description: Letter addressed to M from someone in the office of R. M. Marshall & Brother. Mentions Mama, Mimmie, Mr. P. & Keith

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: R. M. MARSHALL.        ALEX W. MARSHALL.                       STOCKS AND BONDS  REAL ESTATE    R. M. Marshall & Brother,  33 BROAD STREET.    Charleston, S.C. Sept. 12. 1883    M    Dear M,    Yours of Mond. & Tues. or [cc?] today the [Northern?] mail was irregular today so letters did not come through and we have heard nothing further about Mama--I spent last [eveng.?] with Mama played [illegible] in afternoon--T. comes to the office very often but every thing is in such confusion that he has not [illebible]--After two days of cool weather it has got warm again--the garden [illegible line] with gale.  Mr. P. & Keith now expected back from Edisto today--I gave P. [Mimmieâ€™s?] letter today--[illegible] still not well--M will make no [change/charge] at H. M.'s [illegible] [taking?] off the new doors in the gallery and [illegible]; the wall in in sober colors--all the pens have [been?] straightened (a very troublesome job)
